subject: Productivity
title: Perfectionism and Paralysis
description: A quick, practical guide to Perfectionism and Paralysis.

hook.text: A perfectionist stares at a blank page for hours. If it can't be perfect, why start at all?

buildup.text: Perfectionism creates impossible standards. When nothing feels good enough, starting feels pointless.

discovery.text: Research links perfectionism to chronic procrastination. The higher the standard, the deeper the delay.

twist.text: Imperfect action always beats perfect inaction. A rough draft exists; the perfect one never will.

climax.text: Done is better than flawless. Lowering the bar for the first attempt unlocks forward motion.

punchline.text: Perfection is procrastination wearing a mask.

quiz.question: How does perfectionism relate to procrastination?
options: Higher standards lead to deeper delays
